bill_title: establish a pilot project for an alternative care program for adults with substance abuse issues, to provide for a report to the Legislature, and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a pilot project for an alternative care program for adults with substance abuse issues, to provide for a report to the Legislature, and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The secretary of the Department of Corrections shall conduct a pilot program for the purpose of reimbursing a nonprofit, faith-based organization for room and board costs associated with an extended residential care program for indigent adults with alcohol or other substance abuse issues. The recipient, selected by a competitive bid process, shall use the funding for room and board costs relating to the pilot project. The department shall establish criteria that meets standards and best practices of the American Corrections Association for the population to be served and for the residential care services to be provided. Section 2. The department shall prepare a report containing the information on the results and outcomes of the pilot project, the department's recommendations regarding continuing or expanding funding for the program, and its recommendations regarding the development of a payment system for room and board costs for these residential care services providers. The report shall be submitted to the Legislature no later than November 15, 2008. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($ 150,000 ), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Corrections to fund the pilot program established in section 1 of this Act. Section 4. The secretary of the Department of Corrections shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2008, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.
